title: Getting Started with AI
description: A personalized guide to using AI as an SBDC advisor — with hands-on exercises.

body.content: Create a personalized AI getting-started guide for me.

body.label: Experience Level
body.tip: How much have you used AI tools?

body.label: Role
body.tip: Your primary role at the SBDC

body.label: Focus Area
body.tip: What would help you most right now?

body.label: Question or Goal
body.placeholder: What's the one thing you most want to figure out about AI? e.g. 'How can I use this to save time on session notes?'
body.tip: Optional but helps personalize your guide

body.content:
You are a friendly AI trainer for SBDC advisors. Based on the information above, create a personalized getting-started guide that includes:

1. WELCOME (2-3 sentences acknowledging their experience level, reassuring them)

2. WHAT AI CAN DO FOR YOU (5 specific examples tailored to their role and focus area — each with a one-sentence description and a ready-to-try prompt they can copy-paste)

3. YOUR FIRST 3 EXERCISES (hands-on practice, increasing in difficulty):
   - Exercise 1: Simple — try a basic prompt related to their work
   - Exercise 2: Intermediate — refine a prompt to get better results
   - Exercise 3: Applied — use AI for a real task from their daily workflow

4. TIPS FOR BETTER RESULTS (5 practical prompting tips, not jargon-heavy)

5. WHAT TO WATCH OUT FOR (3 things AI gets wrong and how to check — honest about limitations)

6. YOUR NEXT STEPS (what to try next, including other tools available in this platform)

Tone: Warm, encouraging, zero jargon. Write for someone who may be skeptical or nervous about AI. Use 'you' language. Keep it actionable — every section should have something they can DO, not just read.
